author: lavozdegalicia
title: Huelgas a nivel nacional en Vestas Eólica tras romperse la negociación del convenio
text:
El conflicto laboral se enquista y de no haber acuerdo antes del 1 de abril, la plantilla de cada centro de trabajo se regirá por el convenio provincial
27 mar 2025 . Actualizado a las 11:51 h.La mesa negociadora del convenio a nivel español de Vestas Eólica concluyó el pasado martes sin acuerdo, y de no retomarse las conversaciones y haber un pacto en los próximos días —la fecha límite es el primero de abril— la plantilla pasará a regirse por los convenios provinciales de cada centro de trabajo. En Galicia —con sedes en Viveiro, A Estrada y A Coruña— y Asturias hubo varias jornadas de huelga, en la comunidad gallega convocadas por la CIG, y CC.OO. organiza desde hoy paros a nivel estatal.
El conflicto laboral se ha enquistado. Los sindicatos consideran insuficiente la propuesta de la empresa, «que é de mínimos e practicamente a mesma que fixo inicialmente, mentres que as centrais ofrecimos ata sete proposicións, e dúas unificadas», expone José Luis Carro, de la CIG.
A nivel gallego siguen las protestas. Este jueves habrá de nuevo huelga y el personal gallego se concentrará en Lugo y el lunes está prevista una protesta en Muras.
La CIG reclama frenar «a perda de poder adquisitivo e a perda de dereitos laborais» de la plantilla y que la «flexibilidade» que Vestas pretende sea «voluntaria e ben remunerada».

locations.name: La mesa negociadora del convenio a nivel español

author: 大文電子報用戶
title: 與熊貓大使一起護國安
text: 【大公報訊】特區政府一直透過形式多元活動，全方位向市民宣傳國家安全意識。前日（15日）是第十個「全民國家安全教育日」，當局特意製作一批熊貓公仔，贈送予教育日開幕禮的出席者，小學生們獲贈可愛公仔後，將公仔拋上天開心合照。\大公報記者 戴東（文） 林良堅（圖）

author: Correio do Povo
title: Ano começa com mais de 7,5 mil vagas de trabalho no RS
text: Ano começa com mais de 7,5 mil vagas de trabalho no RS Setor dos serviços é o que mais oferece oportunidades permanentes e temporárias publicidade As agências Fgtas/Sine disponibilizam 7.523 vagas de trabalho a partir de terça-feira na Capital e no interior do Estado. Desse total, 6.585 são permanentes, 855 temporárias, 72 para menor aprendiz e 11 para estágio. O setor de serviços é o que mais tem oportunidades tanto fixas como temporárias. Das permanentes, 40% são desse segmento. Já a indústria representa 29% dos postos oferecidos e o comércio, 22%. Não é preciso ter experiência para concorrer a 77% dos cargos, nem escolaridade em 25%. Contudo, os recrutadores de 28% das vagas exigem ensino fundamental completo. Com relação à remuneração, quase metade das ofertas permanentes (44%) remuneram valores de dois a três salários mínimos. Em 26%, os vencimentos são de um e meio a dois salários mínimos. Entre as cidades com maior número de vagas estão Erechim (1.264), Porto Alegre (902), Garibaldi (212), São Leopoldo (209) e Nova Santa Rita (169). As ocupações disponíveis são alimentador de linha de produção (1.189), educador social (369), faxineiro (346), operador de caixa (221), vendedor de comércio varejista (193), atendente de lojas e mercados (177), auxiliar nos serviços de alimentação (150), motorista de caminhão (132), ajudante de motorista (122) e soldador (106). Considerando somente as vagas temporárias, 56% das ocupações são na área dos serviços e 24% na indústria. Para a grande maioria (93%), não é necessário ter experiência prévia e, para 29%, os candidatos não precisam ter escolaridade. Com relação à média salarial das oportunidades, os rendimentos variam de dois a três mínimos em 62% das ofertas. Capão da Canoa é a cidade com mais oportunidades temporárias (235), seguida por Santa Cruz do Sul (80), Rio Pardo (78), Porto Alegre (75) e Imbé (55). Dentre os cargos, estão alimentador de linha de produção (178), operador de caixa (92), atendente de farmácia – balconista (90), atendente de lojas e mercados (73) e repositor de mercadorias (41). Os trabalhadores interessados em se candidatar, presencialmente, na agência mais próxima devem comparecer ao local com documento de identificação com CPF e foto. É importante que o cadastro esteja atualizado atualizado Fgtas/Sine para possível convocação à vaga de emprego. A relação de endereços das unidades está disponível no site fgtas.rs.gov.br/agencias-fgtas-sine. Também é possível retirar a carta de encaminhamento pelo aplicativo Sine Fácil, disponível para download gratuito no Google Play.

author: @CBS7News
title: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car
text: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car CINCINNATI ( [WXIX](https://www.fox19.com/2024/06/21/retired-cpd-sergeant-family-rescue-unknown-tri-state-couple-during-florida-vacation/)/Gray News) - A retired Cincinnati police sergeant and his family saved an Ohio couple who just happened to be vacationing in the same area in Florida. The Ramsey family is from Ohio, while the Bell family lives in northern Kentucky. Up until June 11, the two families had no idea they lived so close to one another. Some might call it a coincidence. Others will say it’s luck, but these two families call it a miracle. Dean and Shana Ramsey recall the moment they said they almost drowned while vacationing in Siesta Key, Florida. Several streets flooded that day after the area received more than 11 inches of rain, an abnormal amount, according to Sarasota County officials. “You couldn’t see anything but rain and water,” Dean Ramsey recalled. With several cars stalled on the road, the couple said they tried to pull off on what they thought was land. “The water sucked us right into that lagoon and that was it,” Dean Ramsey explained. Watching in horror from their condo was retired Cincinnati Police Department sergeant Mike Bell, his wife Ginger Bell and their three young kids. The Bell family responded. “We were able to stop, slow things down, and assess and make some decisions on how we were going to move forward,” Mike Bell said. That plan started with Mackenzie Bell giving valuable information to 911. “I remembered they needed to know the address, so that’s the first thing I told her and then I told her a car is in the pond and there was two people in there,” Mike’s and Ginger Bell’s daughter, Mackenzie Bell, said. Meanwhile, the retired sergeant and his wife, who is an emergency medical doctor, took action. “I went over to the edge of the water and realized it wasn’t sinking immediately, so I have a few minutes,” Mike Bell recounted from that moment. “At that time, Ginger exited the front door next to the pond. I look at her and said, ‘We need flotation devices.’” That’s where little Hank Bell came in. “I didn’t want them to die, so I ran as fast as I could,” Hank Bell explained. “I went up the elevator, which is extremely slow, and I knew there were stairs that were faster. So, I ran down the stairs.” Flotation devices in hand, the Bell kids handed them to their parents who were already in the water. “He went into the lady’s side and I went into the man’s side,” Ginger Bell said. “She was able to climb out on her own, but I put the boogie board right in front of her. She got her body on the boogie board and that’s when I started paddling and we kicked over to the side.” Ginger Bell ran into some issues helping Dean Ramsey. “When he was trying to get out, his foot got stuck, so he was on his back with one foot out and one foot stuck in the steering wheel,” Ginger Bell remembered. “I looked at her and I said, ‘I’m stuck, I can’t,’” Dean Ramsey remembered. “At that time, I was like, ‘I’m going down with the car,’ but she’s like, ‘Get out of this car! You got to get out! Kick your leg!’ I started thrashing my leg and my foot popped out.” The rescue took about five minutes. Back on dry land, the Ramsey family saw their rescuers as “guardian angels.” The families say they have plans to reunite in the near future. The Bell family wants to remind residents to always be mindful of their surroundings and assess a situation before getting involved. They said if your car is going in a body of water, roll down the windows or punch them out by hitting the corners. Those tactics could save a life. Copyright 2024 WXIX via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.
